meta.description: GHSA-j288-q9x7-2f5v: Apache Commons Lang is vulnerable to Uncontrolled Recursion when processing long inputs
meta.name: dependency_with_medium_severity_vulnerabilities

spec.explanation: This package version contains a vulnerability that has been marked as medium severity according to the information in OSV.dev.

source_policy_info.description: Vulnerabilities are issues in software components that may introduce flaws that threaten the confidentiality, integrity, or availability of your software. Raise findings for packages containing known vulnerabilities.
source_policy_info.name: Vulnerabilities

meta.description: Apache Commons Lang is vulnerable to Uncontrolled Recursion when processing long inputs
meta.name: GHSA-j288-q9x7-2f5v

additional_endor_notes:
Refactor:(Changed groupId from  commons-lang to org.apache.commons)
https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/commit/375d7d0954cae60c4c7292cc65abbc972178857c#diff-9c5fb3d1b7e3b0f54bc5c4182965c4fe1f9023d449017cece3005d3f90e8e4d8R28-L30

Refactor:  
Refactored getClass() to support spaces in class names. so implementating the wrapper function  getShortClassName() and getPackageName(), and refactord functions
https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/commit/39c9476337d69f34cb1ace57067f0d2a009785a6#diff-1ccbab553dc9ff17a1cdb0a5c15b75167c18ce0a07d59e54aae6895d7f0c36dfL100

Introduction:(src/java/org/apache/commons/lang/ClassUtils.java)
https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/commit/870097e4b15839c7ba718423b49b4241d911b31a#diff-1ccbab553dc9ff17a1cdb0a5c15b75167c18ce0a07d59e54aae6895d7f0c36dfR105
additional_notes:
Uncontrolled Recursion vulnerability in Apache Commons Lang.

This issue affects Apache Commons Lang: Starting with commons-lang:commons-lang 2.0 to 2.6, and, from org.apache.commons:commons-lang3 3.0 before 3.18.0.

The methods ClassUtils.getClass(...) can throw StackOverflowError on very long inputs. Because an Error is usually not handled by applications and libraries, a StackOverflowError could cause an application to stop.

Users are recommended to upgrade to version 3.18.0, which fixes the issue.

endor_vulnerability.additional_notes:
Refactor:(Changed groupId from  commons-lang to org.apache.commons)
https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/commit/375d7d0954cae60c4c7292cc65abbc972178857c#diff-9c5fb3d1b7e3b0f54bc5c4182965c4fe1f9023d449017cece3005d3f90e8e4d8R28-L30

Refactor:  
Refactored getClass() to support spaces in class names. so implementating the wrapper function  getShortClassName() and getPackageName(), and refactord functions
https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/commit/39c9476337d69f34cb1ace57067f0d2a009785a6#diff-1ccbab553dc9ff17a1cdb0a5c15b75167c18ce0a07d59e54aae6895d7f0c36dfL100

Introduction:(src/java/org/apache/commons/lang/ClassUtils.java)
https://github.com/apache/commons-lang/commit/870097e4b15839c7ba718423b49b4241d911b31a#diff-1ccbab553dc9ff17a1cdb0a5c15b75167c18ce0a07d59e54aae6895d7f0c36dfR105
endor_vulnerability.cve_description: Uncontrolled Recursion vulnerability in Apache Commons Lang. This issue affects Apache Commons Lang: Starting with commons-lang:commons-lang 2.0 to 2.6, and, from org.apache.commons:commons-lang3 3.0 before 3.18.0. The methods ClassUtils.getClass(...) can throw StackOverflowError on very long inputs. Because an Error is usually not handled by applications and libraries, a StackOverflowError could cause an application to stop. descriptions.value:
Uncontrolled Recursion vulnerability in Apache Commons Lang.

This issue affects Apache Commons Lang: Starting with commons-lang:commons-lang 2.0 to 2.6, and, from org.apache.commons:commons-lang3 3.0 before 3.18.0.

The methods ClassUtils.getClass(...) can throw StackOverflowError on very long inputs. Because an Error is usually not handled by applications and libraries, a 
StackOverflowError could cause an application to stop.

Users are recommended to upgrade to version 3.18.0, which fixes the issue.

Vulnerabilidad de recursión incontrolada en Apache Commons Lang. Este problema afecta a Apache Commons Lang: a partir de commons-lang:commons-lang 2.0 a 2.6, y desde org.apache.commons:commons-lang3 3.0 hasta 3.18.0. El método ClassUtils.getClass(...) puede generar un error de StackOverflowError en entradas muy largas. Dado que las aplicaciones y librerías no suelen gestionar un error, un error de StackOverflowError podría provocar la detención de una aplicación. Se recomienda actualizar a la versión 3.18.0, que soluciona el problema.

Uncontrolled Recursion vulnerability in Apache Commons Lang.

This issue affects Apache Commons Lang: Starting with commons-lang:commons-lang 2.0 to 2.6, and, from org.apache.commons:commons-lang3 3.0 before 3.18.0.

The methods ClassUtils.getClass(...) can throw StackOverflowError on very long inputs. Because an Error is usually not handled by applications and libraries, a StackOverflowError could cause an application to stop.

Users are recommended to upgrade to version 3.18.0, which fixes the issue.
osv_vulnerability.summary: Apache Commons Lang is vulnerable to Uncontrolled Recursion when processing long inputs

spec.summary: Apache Commons Lang is vulnerable to Uncontrolled Recursion when processing long inputs

spec.relationship: commons-lang:commons-lang@2.6 is a direct dependency of com.endor.webapp:endor-java-webapp-demo@4.0-SNAPSHOT.
spec.remediation: No patch upgrades available to fix the issue. Check the security advisory for alternative controls or actions.
spec.summary:
commons-lang:commons-lang@2.6 has a medium severity vulnerability identified by GHSA-j288-q9x7-2f5v: Apache Commons Lang is vulnerable to Uncontrolled Recursion when processing long inputs. There is no known fix for this vulnerability at this time.
commons-lang:commons-lang@2.6 is a direct dependency of com.endor.webapp:endor-java-webapp-demo@4.0-SNAPSHOT.
